unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post about scholarship portals in the EdTech category, aimed at Indian students:
normalised: Scholarship Portals: Your Ticket to I I T Dreams (and Beyond!)

unnormalised: **Scholarship Portals: Your Ticket to IIT Dreams (and Beyond!)**
normalised: Hey folks! So, you're dreaming of cracking I I T J E E, or maybe getting into a fancy B-School like I I M Ahmedabad, but the fees look like something out of a Karan Johar film – dramatic and H U G E, right? That's where scholarship portals come in clutch!

unnormalised: Hey folks! So, you're dreaming of cracking IIT JEE, or maybe getting into a fancy B-School like IIM Ahmedabad, but the fees look like something out of a Karan Johar film – dramatic and HUGE, right? That's where scholarship portals come in clutch!
normalised: Think of them as your online khazana (treasure) hunt for funding. Seriously, they're goldmines! Gone are the days of endless paperwork and running around like a headless chicken. Now, you can find scholarships tailored to your caste, academic performance, even extracurricular activities, all in one place.

unnormalised: Think of them as your online khazana (treasure) hunt for funding. Seriously, they're goldmines! Gone are the days of endless paperwork and running around like a headless chicken. Now, you can find scholarships tailored to your caste, academic performance, even extracurricular activities, all in one place.
normalised: I remember my cousin, Rohan, almost gave up on his dream of studying Architecture. Then he stumbled upon a scholarship portal that highlighted specific schemes for students from Rajasthan. Boom! Problem solved.

unnormalised: I remember my cousin, Rohan, almost gave up on his dream of studying Architecture. Then he stumbled upon a scholarship portal that highlighted specific schemes for students from Rajasthan. Boom! Problem solved.
normalised: These portals often list scholarships from central government (like P M scholarship) to private foundations and even international opportunities. They usually let you filter by your course, marks, and maybe even location in India.

unnormalised: These portals often list scholarships from central govt (like PM scholarship) to private foundations and even international opportunities. They usually let you filter by your course, marks, and maybe even location in India.
normalised: Some popular ones are Buddy4Study, Scholarship Corner and Vidyalakshmi. Just be careful to avoid the sketchy websites and double-check the legitimacy of each scholarship before applying. Do your homework folks!

unnormalised: Some popular ones are Buddy4Study, Scholarship Corner and Vidyalakshmi. Just be careful to avoid the sketchy websites and double-check the legitimacy of each scholarship before applying. Do your homework folks!
normalised: Pro-tip: Start your search early! Many scholarships have deadlines months in advance.

unnormalised: Pro-tip: Start your search early! Many scholarships have deadlines months in advance.
